article.headline: UT-Chattanooga 71, Western Carolina 67
article.story: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. (AP) -- Charles Anderson dunked with 7:04 remaining to give Chattanooga the lead for good in its 71-67 win over Western Carolina on Saturday night. Anderson's slam gave the Mocs (17-12, 8-6 Southern Conference) a 51-50 lead over the Catamounts (13-16, 7-7) in the final regular season game for both teams. With the win, Chattanooga has a chance at a bye in the first round of the conference tournament next week. But they need Furman to lose Sunday when they host conference leader Georgia Southern. Anderson scored 17 points and grabbed eight rebounds to lead Chattanooga. He hit eight of nine field goals. Jerice Crouch had 16 points for the Mocs, while Casey Long finished with 10. Antonio Russell led the Catamounts with 21 points, while Corey Muirhead scored 16 to give the senior exactly 1,000 points for his career.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
